actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to mandate a study of the impact on international trade of compliance with international environmental agreements and the justifiability of foreign nation environment, conservation and health laws, and to amend the Trade Act of 1974 and for other purposes.
short_title: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade for the Environment Act of 1991

summary.text: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade for the Environment Act of 1991 - Directs the United States Trade Representative and the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to enter into appropriate arrangements with the National Academy of Sciences to study the impact on international trade of international environmental agreements and foreign nation environment, conservation, and health laws. Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to treat acts and practices of foreign countries that diminish the effectiveness of international agreements on the environment or the conservation of animals or plants as unjustifiable for purposes of the enforcement of U.S. rights under trade agreements.

titles.title: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade for the Environment Act of 1991

A bill to mandate a study of the impact on international trade of compliance with international environmental agreements and the justifiability of foreign nation environment, conservation and health laws, and to amend the Trade Act of 1974 and for other purposes.
